name: The Mona Lisa
the-point: The Mona Lisa has no clearly visible eyebrows because it was fashionable to shave them in the Renaissance.

name: Mummy Brown
the-point: A popular paint pigment in the 18th century was made from ground-up Egyptian mummies.

name: Van Gogh's Sales
the-point: Vincent van Gogh only sold one painting during his entire lifetime.

name: Pencils and Space
the-point: A single pencil has enough graphite to draw a line 35 miles long.

name: The David's Eyes
the-point: Michelangelo’s David is slightly cross-eyed, a detail meant to be corrected by the viewer's angle from below.

name: Blue Rarity
the-point: Ultramarine blue used to be more expensive than gold because it was made from Lapis Lazuli.

name: Origami Math
the-point: If you could fold a piece of paper 42 times, it would reach the moon.

name: Picasso's Name
the-point: Pablo Picasso’s full name contains 23 words.

name: Vantablack
the-point: Vantablack is a substance so dark it absorbs 99.96% of light, making 3D objects look 2D.

name: Dali’s Signature
the-point: Salvador Dalí used to doodle on the backs of checks so that restaurants wouldn't cash them.

name: The Persistence of Memory
the-point: Dalí’s famous melting clocks were actually inspired by Camembert cheese melting in the sun.

name: Color Blindness
the-point: Claude Monet’s late paintings are blurry and reddish because he suffered from cataracts.

name: The Color Pink
the-point: Pink doesn't actually exist as a wavelength of light; our brains invent it to bridge red and violet.

name: Hidden Music
the-point: Leonardo da Vinci’s 'The Last Supper' contains a hidden musical score encoded in the positions of hands and bread.

name: Stealing the Mona Lisa
the-point: The Mona Lisa wasn't famous until it was stolen from the Louvre in 1911.

name: Michelangelo's Poetry
the-point: Michelangelo hated painting the Sistine Chapel so much he wrote a poem about how miserable he was.

name: Digital Art
the-point: The first digital artwork was created in the 1950s using an oscilloscope.

name: Statue Oxidation
the-point: The Statue of Liberty was originally a dull copper color before it oxidized to green.

name: The Scream
the-point: Edvard Munch’s 'The Scream' was inspired by a volcanic eruption in Indonesia that turned the sky red in Norway.

name: Creative Block
the-point: Taking a shower often sparks creativity because the dopamine release and relaxed state trigger 'incubation'.

name: Animation Speed
the-point: Traditional hand-drawn animation requires 24 individual drawings for every one second of film.

name: Banksy’s Shredder
the-point: Banksy built a shredder into a painting frame that activated the moment the art was sold at auction.

name: Cave Art
the-point: Some of the oldest cave paintings were made by Neanderthals, not Homo sapiens.

name: LEGO Art
the-point: There are enough LEGO bricks in the world for every person on Earth to have 102 of them.

name: The Golden Ratio
the-point: Artists use the ratio 1.618 (Phi) to create compositions that are naturally pleasing to the human eye.
